rv anon edits -- "Theotokos" is covered elsewhere, and section headers are to be de-capitalized except for proper names and the first word (as per [[WP:MOS]])
/* The Incarnation */ removing "our" and reference to self "one"
/* The Incarnation */ Removing second person referencing "we"
/* The Incarnation */ +img of a Georgian Orthodox Church
/* Repentance */ concept of age of reason in not universal to the church, greater clarification on the nature of sin, spiritual guidence
/* Church buildings */ Link Iconostasis to its article
Disambiguation link repair - [[Wikipedia:Disambiguation pages with links|You can help!]]
rv -- This is not a list of all possible Orthodox jurisdictions, but rather a reference to those most familiar to English speakers.
/* Conversion of East and South Slavs */
rv oddly phrased and ungrammatical edits
rv additions of RC usage comparison
/* The Great Schism */ fixed some mis-spellings
rv. Inaccuracies, unsourced claims, spelling errors, and misleading edit summary
/* Monasticism */ the end paragraph is removed see discussion
/* Sin and redemption */ see discussion: Women as spiritual mothers and confessors
/* Local Orthodox churches (churches in full communion) */
/* Local Orthodox churches (churches in full communion) */
disambig RC link; restored "Eastern Orthodoxy" in 1st para. (even in 1054, there was more than just Constantinople in the EO world; yes the term is anachronistic, but so is "Roman Catholicism")
rv - hiding sourced information and giving misleading names is not NPOV
/* Local Orthodox churches (churches in full communion) */
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/70.224.163.146|70.224.163.146]] ([[User talk:70.224.163.146|talk]]) to last version by ASDamick
rv -- Let's keep this NPOV, please.
/* The Great Schism */ didn't make any sense
rv -- This really is not a "unique" position, and the previous version got aross the same information more concisely.
rv, see talk. Besides, the edit was needlessly defensive in tone and awkwardly written
see talk concerning the accuracy of this text
/* Saints, relics, and the deceased */ Image:Relics of Saint Demetrius.jpg
attempt to simplify section here, full text is now at new article 'Marriage in the Eastern Orthodox Church'
add further info link for marriage
proper wording. not all Slavic groups were affected by their work
rv. Why are these thought relevant to the article?

wikified and fixed the reference problems
communion --> Communion (Christian). Disambiguation link repair ([[Wikipedia:Disambiguation pages with links|You can help!]])
/* Saints, relics, and the deceased */ simplify link
relics --> Relic. Disambiguation link repair ([[Wikipedia:Disambiguation pages with links|You can help!]])
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/24.54.82.126|24.54.82.126]] ([[User talk:24.54.82.126|talk]]) to last version by ASDamick
rv -- This is not a directory, nor is this school even connected with what is generally recognized as the Orthodox Church.
rv -- This is not a list of all Orthodox churches but rather of the major traditions known to English speakers.
rv -- The color in this photo is better.
added [[Republic of Moldova]]. (Incidentally, according to the Wikipedia article, that country is 98 percent Eastern Orthodox.)
rv -- [[User:Csernica]]'s version is accurate and neutral. This newer one seems as if it's got something to prove.
rv. This is surely overstating the case
The Eastern Orthodox Church is a Chrisitan Denomination, "Protestantism" is Not. Protestantism is composed of numerous denominations
rv -- There is so much variety in Protestantism that it can hardly be said to be a grouping in any coherent sense.
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/24.54.82.126|24.54.82.126]] to last version by Crculver
rv to previous edit by same anon user. Section is on Triadology, not Christology. Mixing the subjects confuses the reader IMO.
rv misplaced and non sequitur edit
rv -- In point of fact, the OCA ("TOCA") maintains overlapping dioceses of its own, organized on ethnic bases.
/* Original Sin */ changed the word 'we' into something less personal
rv -- No need to introduce Latinized Russian terms when English ones will do.
rv edits by [[User:64.233.249.235]] to last version by [[User:Phiddipus]] (vandalism)
"Architecture" and "Not" clearly don't need capital initial letters. "Church" has a capital initial "C" when it's either the name of a church or an abbreviation of a name, but not when it's a common
/* Church buildings */ The use of the word "Temple" is an affectation, Correct terminology is "Church"(Ecclesia) not "Temple" (Templon) which refers to the Altar area
/* Local Orthodox Churches (Churches in Full Communion) */
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/155.201.35.50|155.201.35.50]] ([[User talk:155.201.35.50|talk]]) to last version by Phiddipus
/* The Last Things */ Clarification - also, last line was confusing, man must choose to love God, God doesn't make us love him

unnecessary information; also some is untrue: the ecumenical patriarch is not the head bishop of all orthodox churches; there is only one orthodox church, and each bishop only has his own jurisdiction
/* Anointing with Holy Oil */ Mystery preferred to sacrament - clarification
/* Tradition */ copyedit -- not certain if the new bit meshes well; needs more work
moved oriental orthodox to history, does not need to be in itroduction
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/68.229.54.144|68.229.54.144]] to last version by Aquarius Rising
rv -- That's one of the very minor jurisdictions, and we're not intending here to list them all.
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/128.119.236.149|128.119.236.149]] to last version by 172.205.172.253
Edited content a bit (It was taken from Oriental Orthodoxy article and from French Wikipedia article on Eastern Orthodoxy.)
/* The Church in North America */ Put preferred name first
/* The Church in North America */ dewik redundant link
/* The Church in North America */ copyedit, rm mention of non-notable non-Orthodox group
rv. Sorry, but this is a common mischaracterization of the events of 1054.
/* Footnote */ Changed footnote, but I really don't know about a mention in the intro
/* The Church today */ shrink photo down to a reasonable size
added reference to Republic of Macedonia, along with explanatory footnote for Footnote section of the article.
rv -- This church is not in communion with the rest.
/* Local Orthodox Churches (Churches in Full Communion) */
rv -- This nation keeps getting added and removed, mainly because its church is not recognized by any other E.O. churches.
added: Republic of Macedonia. (Note: I have no objection if anyone changes it to Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia.)
There really isn't a "strong influence" of Orthodoxy in Poland. Only 1.3% of Poles are Orthodox. See: [[Demographics of Poland]].
correct previous edit summary: also emigration issue
/* Mystery */ This whole section is POV and does not contain any information not found elsewhere
/* The Theotokos */ If her hymen was broken by birth, she would still be a virgin. It is not "theologically paramount" to believe that her hymen remained intact after birth. Use commas correctly too.
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/24.64.223.203|24.64.223.203]] to last version by 71.126.174.132
/* Monasticism */ Well, I had just intended to shift the information about imitation of Christ's Passion from "Resurrection" to here, but...
/* The Resurrection */ Copyedit, some factual corrections. We should standardize on either "Hades" or "Hell"; to use both is confusing.
rv: majorit of Armenian Christians are jurisdictionally separated from this church
/* The Great Schism */ it has a name
/* Fasting */ linked fixed broken 'imitation crabmeat ' link to redirect to Surimi
/* Conversion of the Slavs */ POV - chauvinism is never for the better
That country is 40% muslim, plus NOT official recognised by the Orthodox community.
rv. Coptic church is Oriental Orthodox, not Eastern Orthodox
Removing image with no source information. Such images that are older than seven days may be deleted at any time.
/* Saints, relics, and the deceased */ grammar correction in 4th para
/* Sin and redemption */ spelling correction (sinfullness -> sinfulness)
As this church does not yet enjoy widespread acceptance, it belongs here. In any event, it didn't belong in the place it occupied in the list, which is more or less in order of seniority.
rv badly written and iffy anon edition and inclusion of Armenia (which is [[Oriental Orthodox]], not E. Orthodox)
rv -- Those churches are indeed subject to the MP
Removing image with no source information. Such images that are older than seven days may be deleted at any time.
/* Local Orthodox Churches */ Indian Orthodox Church is either Nestorian or Miaphysite, I can't tell, but it's definitely not EO.
/* Church buildings */ simplified caption, copyedit, incl. a good bit of de-capitalization
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/131.111.8.103|131.111.8.103]] ([[User talk:131.111.8.103|talk]]) to last version by Valentinian
rv anon edit -- seems almost non sequitur.
rv. No, it's not about Catholicism. Cite, please, if you're going to insist on this.
/* Conversion of the Slavs */ region of - no one can prove it was exactly the vernacular of the city that became codified
Rv. I've never heard of this, so I must insist on a reference.

rv -- Deaconesses are not simply female deacons, and should be treated separately.
/* Monasticism */ No, not all of them.
/* The Church today */ removing unnecessary parentheses
rv -- The sentence removed did not refer to the ROCOR, but to the "Holy Orthodox Catholic and Apostolic Church of America."
/* The Church in North America */ ROCOR is already mentioned, there is no need for this anti-ROCOR POV statement. Likewise, ROCOR's Orthodoxy is not in question, only its canonicity.
/* The Church in North America */ fix wik
